meanings.definition: Made or became more solid or stable.
meanings.sent1: The firmed ground provided a sturdy base for the house.
meanings.sent2: The firmed jelly set perfectly in the mold.
meanings.sent3: The firmed pudding wobbled playfully on the plate.
meanings.sent4: Her firmed resolve was like a rock in the storm of doubt.
meanings.sent5: The firmed clay sculpture stood proudly on the shelf.

meanings.sent1: She firmed her grip on the railing to steady herself.
meanings.sent2: The new evidence firmed up their case against the suspect.
meanings.sent3: He firmed his belief in aliens after watching a sci-fi movie.
meanings.sent4: The handshake firmed their agreement to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging words firmed her resolve to pursue her dreams.

meanings.definition: Made a decision or plan more definite or certain.
meanings.sent1: After discussing all options, they firmed up their vacation plans.
meanings.sent2: The team firmed their commitment to the project by signing the contract.
meanings.sent3: She firmed her decision to quit her job after a long period of contemplation.
meanings.sent4: The new information firmed their resolve to take action.
meanings.sent5: The successful test run firmed their belief in the new product design.
